author: Michael Larabel
description: While the Rust Coreutils project has been generating a lot of interest recently from the uutils initiative, the upstream GNU Coreutils project isn't slowing down and today is out with GNU Coreutils 9.8 for shipping the newest features...
title: GNU Coreutils 9.8 Released With New Features

author: Michael Larabel
description: RPM 6.0 is out today as the newest major update to the RPM Package Manager as the package management system most commonly associated with Red Hat / Fedora, openSUSE, Mageia / OpenMandriva, and others...
title: RPM 6.0 Released With OpenPGP Improvements & Enforces Signature Checking By Default

author: Michael Larabel
description: With last week's official release of ROCm 7.0 failing to mention the AMD Ryzen AI Max "Strix Halo" SoCs on the supported GPU list, a number of Phoronix readers and from elsewhere were inquiring whether or not Strix Halo works with the new ROCm release. Various AMD folks have mentioned Strix Halo with ROCm, so I decided to run some benchmarks for myself of ROCm 7.0 on Ubuntu Linux with the AMD Ryzen AI Max 395 with Radeon 8060S Graphics on the Framework Desktop.
title: AMD Ryzen AI Max+ "Strix Halo" Performance With ROCm 7.0

author: Michael Larabel
description: XTX Markets as one of the largest algorithmic trading firms that handles $250 billion in daily traded volume and relies on around 650+ petabytes of storage for its price forecasts and other algorithmic trading data has open-sourced its Linux file-system. XTX developed TernFS for distributed storage after they outgrew their original NFS usage and other file-system alternatives...
title: A Major Trading Firm Has Open-Sourced The Latest Linux File-System: TernFS

author: Michael Larabel
description: Queued up into DRM-Next is a last batch of Intel Xe kernel graphics driver improvements ahead of the Linux 6.18 merge window that is expected to begin next week. With this last minute Intel Xe driver activity is also a new power management knob for those wanting to run their Intel graphics slightly more efficient...
title: Linux 6.18 Adding A New Power Savings Option For The Intel Graphics Driver

author: Michael Larabel
description: The third weekly alpha release of the upcoming FreeBSD 15 operating system is now available for testing...
title: FreeBSD 15.0 Alpha 3 Brings WiFi Driver Updates

author: Michael Larabel
description: Raspberry Pi today announced the M.2 HAT+ Compact as a new smaller version of their M.2 HAT+ for these single board computers...
title: Raspberry Pi Releases M.2 HAT+ Compact For $15
